title: UK weather: Met Office puts much of England on flooding alert
text:
Swathes of England face possible flooding on Monday as heavy rain sweeps across the country, the Met Office has warned.

Forecasters said more than two inches of rain could fall within 12 hours in parts of the country.

The Met Office has issued a yellow weather warning stretching from Devon on the south coast to South Yorkshire from midday until midnight.

Cities including Manchester, Birmingham, Nottingham, Oxford, London and Portsmouth are also within the warning area.

The Met Office said the wet weather will move northwards across much of England on Monday, with the heaviest rain forecast for the afternoon and evening.
description: Swathes of England face possible flooding on Monday as heavy rain sweeps across the country, the Met Office has warned.
